newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end down but off lows.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end down but off lows.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended weak but off their lows on Tuesday, as uncertainty about the direction of Japanese government policy after Sunday's election continued to weigh on the market.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 December contract recovered from a low of 21,060 to end at 21,195 against a previous settlement at 21,245.

"As long as it stays above 21,125, it should consolidate to head higher," said a trader with a local institution, adding that the December Nikkei would need to close above 21,360 to signal a clearer uptrend.
Dealers said players were awaiting the formation of a ruling coalition after the Liberal Democratic Party's failure to gain a majority in Sunday's general election.
The trader players were also concerned about how Japanese manufacturers would be affected by the current high levels of crude oil prices.
"Japan is a net importer of energy and crude oil prices have been buoyant, which is the reason the Nikkei can't go higher, faster," he said.
